description: Borrowed from Latin trepidātiō, from trepidō (“be agitated”).

entries.meaning: A fearful state; a state of concern or hesitation.
examples: Synonyms: agitation, apprehension, consternation, fear, hesitation, worry
I decided, with considerable trepidation, to let him drive my car without me.

entries.meaning: An involuntary trembling, sometimes an effect of paralysis, but usually caused by terror or fear.

(astronomy, obsolete) A libration of the starry sphere in the Ptolemaic system; a motion ascribed to the firmament, to account for certain small changes in the position of the ecliptic and of the stars.
